cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.MM, cs.SY, cs.COM 

This paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT) sub-category as it deals with improving the efficiency of beam tracking in millimeter wave communications, which is a key challenge in this field. Additionally, the paper also discusses the use of statistical beamforming gains, which is a common concept in information theory. 

The paper could also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category as it deals with improving the performance of communication networks, specifically in the context of millimeter wave communications. 

The Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category is also a possibility as the paper deals with improving the performance of communication systems that transmit multimedia content, which is a key application of millimeter wave communications. 

The Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category is another possibility as the paper discusses a beam tracking scheme that involves estimating the gains of beam configurations, which is a control problem. 

Finally, the Computer Communications and Networks (cs.COM) sub-category is a possibility as the paper deals with improving the performance of communication networks, which is a key area of research in computer communications and networks.
